KTMM: TIERED MEMORY MODULE¶

The KTMM Project is a module for the Linux kernel designed to enhance the current Clock algorithm for page replacement. The implemention is an alternate approach to a dynamic tiering system for memory intensive applications on modern server platforms.

Prerequisites & Installation¶

These articles cover information regarding system setups, testing environments, and how to install the module.

  • System Requirements
  • Testing Environment Setup
  • WSL Nested Virtualization
  • Module Installation
